body.p: This topic contains reusable fragments for the installation topics. The reuse strategy is to ensure that key values can be edited and compared in one place. We reuse in big chunks as reusing highly granular pieces just makes things hard to edit without any real maintainability win. In some cases, content that fits in only one topic is still included here and conrefed into the topic to keep all the information, such as requirements, in one file for ease of editing.

section.title: Installation Requirements Reusables
section.p: In this section, the reusable element is the dd element of each dlentry. Where the requirement is the same across platform, there is one entry per requirement that is used in all platforms. Where there are different requirements per platform, the id of the reusable dd element is in the form requirement.platform (for instance, memory.windows).

uses the following rules to determine which installed version of Java to use:
If you install using the native Windows installer, which installs a version of Java as part of the installation, the version in the jre subdirectory of the installation directory is used.
Otherwise, if the Windows environment variable JAVA_HOME is set, uses the Java version pointed to by this variable.
Otherwise, the version of Java pointed to by your PATH environment variable is used.

p.ph: A license server can only manage one license key. If you have multiple license keys for the same version and you want to have all of them managed by the same server, or if you have a multiple-user floating license and you want to split it between two or more license servers, contact the Oxygen support team and ask for a new license key.

body.p:
To install an add-on that is hosted on a remote update site, follow these steps:
Go to Help Install new add-ons .
In the displayed dialog box, enter or paste the update site that hosts the add-on in the Show add-ons from field (or select it from the drop-down menu, if applicable). The default add-ons are hosted on http://www.oxygenxml.com/InstData/Addons/default/updateSite.xml. If you want to see a list of all the default and sample add-ons that are available on the Oxygen remote update sites, choose ALL AVAILABLE SITES from the drop-down menu. The add-ons list contains the name, status, update version, version, and the type of the add-on (either framework, or plugin). A short description of each add-on is presented under the add-ons list.To see all the versions of the add-ons, deselect Show only compatible add-ons and Show only the latest version of the add-ons. Incompatible add-ons are shown only to acknowledge their presence on the remote update site, but you cannot install an incompatible add-on.
Choose the add-ons you want to install, press the Next button, then follow the on-screen instructions.Accepting the license agreement of the add-on is a mandatory step in the installation process.All add-ons are installed in the extensions directory inside the preferences directory.
